page.title: 20Summary of Longworth
page.content: Longthworth is a medium sized village about 15 miles west of Oxford and set in a rural environment, a mile from the main Oxford to Swindon road. The village is a mixture of old houses and cottages together with more modern council housing. The is an old Manor House and church. The village is mentioned in the original Domesday Book. The land is high and flat with a steep escarpment running down to the valley of the Thames. Most of the locality is used for arable farming with a small amount of market gardening. Most of the inhabitants commute to work in Oxford, Abingdon or Faringdon, or are employed at the Atomic Energy Research Establishment at Harwell some 12 miles from the village.
